thread.title: NFL sets cap percentages for franchise tags
thread.title_full: NFL sets cap percentages for franchise tags

author: Mike Florio
title: NFL sets cap percentages for franchise tags
text:
Feb 14, 2017 7:15 PM 
Well, aint that a daisy. Feb 14, 2017 7:22 PM 
They used to say “Mama don’t let your babies grow up to be punters” 
Now you see $4.77M for one year of about 75 kicks, and you change your tune. streetyson says: Feb 14, 2017 7:30 PM 
To simplify, for each position, a running average of the top 5 salaries over the past 5 years, are then calculated as a percentage of the 5yr running average of the cap – I think. 
I guess this is done to smooth out any odd year (say when a few top QBs all re-sign in the same year) from skewing the franchise tag value the following year. justintuckrule says: Feb 14, 2017 7:32 PM 
JPP getting that 16 point. arwiv says: Feb 14, 2017 7:34 PM 
I still fail to see how tackles, guards/centers arent broken down into two categories. bemylovetractor says: Feb 14, 2017 7:35 PM 
Meanwhile, the Pats refuse to pay Brady fair market value because, you know, he has a rich, super model wife. Leave a Reply
